alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:58PM EST until January 18 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Morris, Essex and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Pine Brook...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. At 20.0 feet, Eagle Rock Avenue in Roseland is subject to flooding. Camp Lane Road, River Edge Drive and Broadway Lane in Fairfield are flooded. Stewart Place is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Wednesday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 18.0 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.1 feet on 06/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.1 Wed 8 pm 18.7 18.2 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EST.
